sentences.en: He displayed himself steadfastly resolved to propitiate and favour that implacable city.
sentences.cn: 他表示决心同这个结下深仇的城市和解,并予以照顾.

sentences.en: I've never gone out of my way to propitiate people.
McKinley was eager to propitiate the agrarian Middle west after close over Bryan in 1896.
sentences.cn: 麦金莱于1896年在力量相匹敌的情况下战胜布赖恩后,急于要抚慰中西部农民.

sentences.en: Sacrifices were made to propitiate the gods.
sentences.cn: 人们供奉祭品以求神灵息怒。

sentences.en: These ancient ceremonies propitiate the spirits of the waters.
sentences.cn: 这些古老的仪式让水中的神灵平息了怒气。

sentences.en: They offer a sacrifice to propitiate the god.
sentences.cn: 他们供奉祭品以慰诸神.

sentences.en: They offered sacrifices to propitiate the gods.
sentences.cn: 他们供奉祭品以求神息怒.

trans.tran_en: to make someone who has been unfriendly or angry with you feel more friendly by doing something to please them
